title: Zombie Army 4: Dead War has a release date and a zombie shark
text:
Zombie Army 4 – as if zombie Nazis weren’t bad enough

Rebellion’s shlock horror shooter Zombie Army 4 will be out next February, as the latest trailer showcases more WWII era zombie-bashing.

Whether it’s the infamous scene from Zombi 2 or the undead marine monster from the first Resident Evil, zombies and sharks always seem to make a good combination as both rivals and allies. And now they’re going to be in Zombie Army 4.

Rebellion’s co-op shooter was already looking like good wholesome fun at E3 and now it’s got a confirmed release date of 4 February 2020, on Xbox One, PlayStation 4, and PC – with the latter being a 12-month Epic Games Store exclusive.

And if the new trailer below seems enticing enough to you then there’s a pre-order bonus of an Undead Airman Character Pack, featuring British zombie Hector and his stiff upper lip (although presumably every part of a zombie is pretty stiff).

Advertisement

Advertisement

If you’re even more keen than that then there’s also a Collector’s Edition that comes with a 10” zombie shark figurine.

That’s in addition to an exclusive collector’s edition box, 60-page art book, SteelBook case, digital soundtrack sampler, and the aforementioned Undead Airman Character Pack.

The Collector’s Edition costs £89.99 from GAME, but if that’s a bit too rich for your blood then there is the £64.99 Super Deluxe Edition or the regular Deluxe Edition for £49.99.

Zombie Army 4 Super Deluxe Edition

• 3 new campaign levels

• 4 new character packs

• 9 new weapon bundles

• 5 new weapon skin packs

• 4 new character outfit packs

Zombie Army 4 Deluxe Edition

• Undead Airman Character Pack

• Solid Gold Weapon Pack

• FG-24 Semi-Auto Rifle Bundle

• The Undercover Karl Character Outfit Pack
